docs.title: Buildblog
docs.text:
Welcome to Abhishek's Buildblog - a space to know the progress and thoughts of my progress through Buildspace's N&W S5 program.

Check out my public profile that showcases my Buildspace profile.

Click the blog to find out more!

docs.title: Introduction to Buildspace
docs.text:
I am participating in the 5th season of Buildspace's Nights and Weekends! Read more to find out what all this is about!

Last week, I got into Buildspace's Nights and Weekends program (S5). I am very excited about joining this space, meeting with the people, and more importantly working on my passion project.

docs.title: What is Buildspace?
docs.text: Simply put, Buildspace is a 6-week program that you can join to work on whatever interests you - from tech to music to just about anything.

docs.title: Why did you join Buildspace?
docs.text: The program's branding as well as the success stories caught my attention. Upon closer look, the ideas, the vibes, and the intent behind the program and its founders made me want to submit an application and here I am!

docs.title: What was the process?
docs.text: You simply apply on Buildspace detailing various questions on what you want to build. In addition, they have this thing called sage which allows you to find people who are working on whatever projects.

docs.title: What will YOU be building?
docs.text:
The main question. Week One is dedicated to ideation and as such, I will dedicate this week to come out with a final idea.

However, I know my focus lies on making tech that makes immigration an easier and better process for many people.

How successful I am in this - I will only know at the end!

docs.title: Introduction to Week One
docs.text:
Going through Week One of Buildspace

Last to last week, I completed Week 1 of Buildspace which was going through the ideation process.

This post is a bit late in terms of updating the progress on that and that is due to life just getting in the way haha!

Okay, but onto the the first week.

docs.title: What was in Week 1
docs.text:
In week 1, our primary task was to search and finalize on an idea that we would be committed to work through the next 6 weeks.

This consistted of condensing our idea into a one-liner, sharing with others, and then, contributing to the feedback for others.

docs.title: What was your idea in Week 1?
docs.text:
My idea that I want to work on during these 6 weeks is in the intersection of AI and immigration.

In one-line:

an ai application that helps intl. students be informed and prepared for immigration

The name of this application is called borderless and it will aim to provide a personalized help to people regarding their immigration issues with the use of AI.

docs.title: Why did you pick this idea?
docs.text:
Immigration is an issue with many complex and unique cases.

The key insight for this idea is this:

People still ask the same questions

You would think that after years and years of online information, user guides, law firms providing QnA forums, people would be able to find answers easily.

However, that is not the case because while it might be the same question, it will have a small addition/deletion that will make it an unique case.

In the end, people want personalized help for their personalized cases.

It is a question of information filtering - not giving them more information.
